717834f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, at the northern end of the bridge across the Harlem River, showing the Marble Hill Station of the New York Central Railroad and a general view northeastward, with buildings in the Borough
of the Bronx, across the background.
October 26, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

715827f-a.text:
(1)
W. 225th Street (center of view, running from left to right) east from but not including Broadway, as seen from the Marble Hill station of the New York central Railroad, at the Harlem River, slightly east of Broadway.  The buildings shown in the background are in the Borough of the Bronx;  the county line running north and south at a point just west of where the Street makes a sharp bend.

October 26, 1927

(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from the 225th Street Elevated Station of the 7th Avenue-Van Cortlandt Park line of the I.R.T. Subway, on Broadway.  The shed like structures (foreground) are one-story garages.

June 26, 1935

715827f-b.text:
(1)
W. 225th Street (center of view, running from left to right) east from but not including Broadway, as seen from the Marble Hill station of the New York central Railroad, at the Harlem River, slightly east of Broadway.  The buildings shown in the background are in the Borough of the Bronx;  the county line running north and south at a point just west of where the Street makes a sharp bend.

October 26, 1927

(2)
The same, at a later date, as seen from the 225th Street Elevated Station of the 7th Avenue-Van Cortlandt Park line of the I.R.T. Subway, on Broadway.  The shed like structures (foreground) are one-story garages.

June 26, 1935

715826f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, at W. 225th Street and northward showing a panoramic view photographed from the elevated station. Broadway is on the left and W. 225th Street on the right. Apartment buildings in the background are in the Bronx and are on the ridge that formerly was the far bank of the old Spuyten Duyvil Creek. This stream was diverted into the Harlem River and the bed filled in, making the Bronx contiguous with Marble Hill.

The gas station see in the foreground is at the N. E. corner of Broadway and W. 225th Street. The tin garages adjoining are on the latter thoroughfare.

July 15, 1939.

P. L. Sperr

715826f-b.text:
Broadway, east side, at W. 225th Street and northward showing a panoramic view photographed from the elevated station. Broadway is on the left and W. 225th Street on the right. Apartment buildings in the background are in the Bronx and are on the ridge that formerly was the far bank of the old Spuyten Duyvil Creek. This stream was diverted into the Harlem River and the bed filled in, making the Bronx contiguous with Marble Hill.

The gas station see in the foreground is at the N. E. corner of Broadway and W. 225th Street. The tin garages adjoining are on the latter thoroughfare.

July 15, 1939.

P. L. Sperr
